maml:description.maml:para: Select-Backup (Version 4.2.0.6, 26 Dec 2013). Save recently changed PowerShell files to a number of USB devices.

This Cmdlet will backup recently changed PowerShell files (see the Parameters section for details) from any selected folders (default being $pwd) to any number of inserted USB devices, including Hard Disks, on which an archive folder 'PSarchive' will be created if it does not already exist. Enter any valid comma separated strings of files and folders (with no final '\' or '*') which will all be processed in a single operation. As any USB Hard Disk appears as a local system disk (DeviceType 3) the default '-Exclude' parameter is set to drives C:\ and D:\, which can be changed to suit. Attempting to input filetypes other than those listed above will generate an error.
Any folder from which files are to be included. Either enter the full filepath or PowerShell shortcut, $pwd for example, for the PowerShell Working Directory.
The filetypes to be included. Valid values are ps1, psc1, psm1, psd1, Clixml, ps1xml, csv, xml and xaml. Entering any others will generate an error.
Drives to be excluded from the backup. The default is CD as these are DeviceType 3, which is the same as any external USB Hard Disk.
Displays verbose information, such as the last write time of each file on both the Hard Disk and USB device.

Indicates when the file was first created and the size, in Kb. Any file not backed up before will be tagged as 'New'. -Interval and -Size are mutually exclusive and setting both will suppress the latter.
Any folder from which files are to be included. Either enter the full filepath or PowerShell shortcut, $pwd for example, for the PowerShell Working Directory.
The filetypes to be included. Valid values are ps1, psc1, psm1, psd1, Clixml, ps1xml, csv, xml and xaml. Entering any others will generate an error.
Drives to be excluded from the backup. The default is CD as these are DeviceType 3, which is the same as any external USB Hard Disk.
Displays verbose information, such as the last write time of each file on both the Hard Disk and USB device.

Indicates when the file was first created and the size, in Kb. Any file not backup up before will be tagged as 'New'. The switches -Interval and -Size are mutually exclusive so that setting both will suppress the latter.

Show what actions will be performed on any suitable files without performing any copy operation. Note that this may produce a considerable amount of information if more than one USB is attached, as each file outputs a message for each of the devices.
Only used if each copy operation needs to be confirmed. Prompts to reply Y(Yes) or A(Yes to All).

maml:alert.maml:para: If the message 'WARNING: Error on drive X:\ - restart.' keeps appearing, manually enter 'Test-Path X:\' before resubmitting, which seems to cure the problem! Also ensure that all devices have a VolumName before starting, otherwise '-<BLANK>-' will be shown in the summary. If using pipeline input for the Folder parameter, any string variables must be enclosed in quotes, such as "$pwd\Myfiles\copies". In order to terminate any long-running instance of this module just enter the usual Ctrl+C combination from the keyboard. Using the Help command 'Get-Help Select-Backup -online' will link to the SeaStar web site where other Windows utilities can be found, including the GPRS cmdlet. Just click the 'PowerShell Cmdlets' tab there.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add this in a named function in $profile and it will also exclude drive E from the backup devices used. Drives C & D are excluded by default).

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Select-Backup $pwd,c:\scripts\modules\library psm1,xaml -exclude cde -s VERBOSE: --> (Created 30/11/2011 18:21:00, Size 2Kb) counter.psm1 VERBOSE: New (Created 25/12/2013 21:53:50, Size 1Kb) NewFile2.psm1 VERBOSE: New (Created 25/12/2013 13:09:52, Size 1Kb) Nothing.xaml Backup to device(s) [I:\(SD)] completed; 3 file(s) copied.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Backup all psm1 and xaml files from two folders and exclude drives C,D,E. Show '-Size' output which will display the name of each file processed and both the original creation time (HDD) and the size (in Kb) on disk.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 3 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $pwd,"c:\scripts\modules\library" | Select-Backup -Types psm1,xaml -exclude cde -s VERBOSE: --> (Created 30/11/2011 18:21:00, Size 2Kb) counter.psm1 VERBOSE: New (Created 25/12/2013 21:53:50, Size 1Kb) NewFile2.psm1 VERBOSE: New (Created 25/12/2013 13:09:52, Size 1Kb) Nothing.xaml Backup to device(s) [I:\(SD)] completed; 3 file(s) copied.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The same as Example 2, but using the pipeline to input two folders. The -Types switch is used to select psm1 and xaml.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 4 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Select-Backup -folder c:\scripts -i VERBOSE: (HDD) 25/12/2013 13:07:44 (USB) 25/12/2013 12:51:42 counter.ps1 VERBOSE: (HDD) 25/12/2013 21:53:50 (USB Archiving new file) NewFile2.ps1 VERBOSE: (HDD) 25/12/2013 13:09:53 (USB Archiving new file) Nothing.ps1 Backup to device(s) [I:\(SD),J:\(BACKUP)] completed; 3 file(s) copied.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Select any ps1 files (default) to be archived from the 'c:\scripts' folder. Using the '-Interval' switch shows the time difference that has tagged any file for archive.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 5 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Select-Backup -folder c:\scripts -i -whatif What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "J:\PSarchive\counter.ps1". What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "K:\PSarchive\counter.ps1". What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "J:\PSarchive\NewFile2.ps1". What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "K:\PSarchive\NewFile2.ps1". What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "J:\PSarchive\Nothing.ps1". What if: Performing the operation "Copy File" on target "K:\PSarchive\Nothing.ps1". Backup to device(s) [J:\(SD),K:\(BACKUP)] completed; 0 file(s) copied.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Show what actions would be performed before executing the command. Note that output from switches '-I' and '-S' will be suppressed.
